result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis Gdeon Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw II in court for Marquis Gdeon Harris.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40. Court vacated jury trial date of 9-26-2022.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Marquis Gdeon Harris.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests an adjourned final pretrial date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by July 26, 2022 and all responses to be filed by August 23, 2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in Court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense requested Status. Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquis Gdeon Harris in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/14/22 @ 2:30p
